text: George Pieczenik Smith (born March 10, 1941) is an American chemist. He is the Curatorsâ€™ Distinguished Professor Emeritus of Biological Sciences at the University of Missouri-Columbia. He is best known for phage displays. It is when a specific protein's genetic code is artificially inserted into a bacterophage's coat protein gene. In 2018, he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry alongside Greg Winter and Frances Arnold. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:Living people Category:American chemists Category:Scientists from Connecticut Category:People from Norwalk, Connecticut
title: George P. Smith
